name: umount
desc: `umount` command is used to unmount mounted file systems.

-c.name: immediately interrupt the unmount operation in progress

-n.name: do not update /etc/mtab file when unmounting

-r.name: mount the file system in read-only mode

--no-canonicalize.name: do not convert the mount point path to the real path

--no-sync.name: unmount the file system in asynchronous mode

content:
Example

Unmount a file system

umount /mnt

Unmount all mounted file systems

umount -a

Unmount a specific file system type

umount -t ext4 /mnt

Mount the file system in read-only mode

umount -r /mnt
